name: Lydford Gorge Railway Path, Lydford Gorge

ai.summary: A gentle 3.4 km linear route along the former railway line at Lydford Gorge, offering easy terrain and scenic views of the gorge and river in the UK.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat with a mix of well-trodden paths and occasional boardwalk sections; some uneven ground and steps near viewpoints; can be muddy after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and watch your step on uneven surfaces. Stay on marked paths and supervise children near water. Expect varying weather; bring a layer and rain protection. The Gorge can be busy near viewpoints; keep an eye out for other walkers and give way where needed.
recommended_gear: Sunscreen and hat in sunny weather
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are ideal for this easy, scenic route; summer offers longer daylight and river views, while autumn highlights foliage. Winter visits can be muddy and conditions may be more limited.

seo.title: Lydford Gorge Railway Path – Easy 3.4 km Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 3.4 km Lydford Gorge Railway Path, an easy, family-friendly walk along a historic railway line in Lydford Gorge, UK. Gentle terrain with scenic gorge views.
seo.h1: Lydford Gorge Railway Path – 3.4 km Easy Walk
